FIGURE 1.3:  TROPICAL CYCLONE 
 
TROPICAL CYCLONE HARUNA 
Tropical cyclone Haruna developed in the Mozambique Channel on 18 February 2013. 
It reached a peak wind speed of 150 km per hour. It weakened significantly when it 
reached land, where a previous system had already flooded the land. When Haruna 
arrived, 7 402 houses were destroyed, rice and maize crops were damaged, 26 people 
were killed, 127 injured and there was an outbreak of diseases after the tropical 
cyclone dissipated. It dissipated on 24 February 2013. 
 
 
 
 
[Source: South African Weather Service]
